jobDescription: The Translational Oncology group at Abbvie uses advanced methods to discover biomarkers and implement translational medicine strategies to progress Abbvie’s innovative Oncology pipeline. We are currently seeking highly motivated individuals to join our team to support the development and implementation of Translational medicine strategies, for Abbvie sponsored clinical trials. As a member of both discovery and clinical development project teams he/she will have the opportunity to work in a highly collaborative environment to support projects across all phases of clinical development.Key Responsibilities Include:Support or lead development and implementation of translational medicine strategies for Oncology compounds, including evaluation of pharmacodynamics and sensitivity/resistance markers.Partner with clinical and discovery groups to execute high quality biomarker strategies in the clinic.Lead multi-disciplinary Translational Oncology subteam(s) to enable cross-functional collaboration on biomarker implementation.Evaluate, interpret, and present clinical biomarker data to guide project decisions and direction.Drive efforts to evaluate and implement novel, state of the art technologies and concepts for clinical biomarker studies.Implement standardized and cutting edge tools in clinical trials to establish target engagement, develop patient selection biomarker strategies, and inform back translation research.Design and perform experiments to elucidate resistance mechanisms that can be developed into biomarkers and new therapeutics.Author the translational research portions in key clinical documents including protocols/informed consents, Clinical Study Reports, Health Authority Briefing Books and submissions.Provide hands-on clinical trial support, including supporting sample management, lab work, and report generation.Function as an internal expert in oncology biomarkers and precision medicine and actively educate other cross-functional team members through knowledge sharing.Present and report data for internal governance, and external meetings and publications.
